title: Didn't work as expected, didn't uninstall properly
comment: I installed this to try to block ads in apps, which didn't appear to work.  So I uninstalled the app, and my device was no longer able to connect to the internet.  That's right, uninstalling AdBlock Plus caused my phone to block almost all connections.  I couldn't download/update apps, browse the internet, or use BaconReader to access reddit.  I tried re-installing AdBlock Plus by downloading the app from my desktop to see if it was the culprit, and my internet started working again.  To test to make sure, I uninstalled it again, low and behold my internet ceases to work.    Luckily, I just found out: the only way to properly get rid of this app without screwing over your phone, is to first disable the filter inside the app, THEN uninstall it.  You guys should fix this.

title: Schizophrenic App
comment: I can only speak for myself, but if I'm installing something like an ad blocker, it's because I find intrusive things annoying. This app keeps the ugly stop sign icon in your notifications bar, which I find far more annoying than the occasional ad it's supposed to block. As to the bigger question of the ad-based revenue model that is so prevalent among Android apps, and the justification for consumers like me to block ads, I have little sympathy, as I generally buy the paid version of any app I enjoy. So it's really only web browsing I'm interested in blocking ads on, and even then, it's a minor issue, as I find very few mobile sites actually have ads.

title: Great tool
comment: Its a great tool, about time I got to remove Adfree, but it seriously needs an option to disable the notification icon, its ridiculously bad looking in the notification area. Giving it 5 stars because the application works as intended, the icon thingy has nothing to do with the functionality itself, but rather annoyance. Keep it up please and make sure you read the user reviews to improve your product.

title: Excellent
comment: Definitely needs a way to turn off the notification bar icon but (or at least let me pick an invisible icon if that isn't possible)  But otherwise it's great.
Not sure which is worse, the ads or having that annoying notification from the app all the time. If you're running 4.1 you can disable it in settings > apps>disable notifications.

title: Works, but annoying icon
comment: Does what it says. Ads are gone. Sadly just while on Wi-Fi, since I haven't rooted the device-- even though using my data plan is the time when I really could use the speed increase from no ads.  The tray icon might be more annoying than the ads, though. I guess I'll turn it off when I'm not using it, for now.

title: Looks promising
